intro: Verbesina viguieroides, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange inflorescences that resemble a crown. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers arranged in a dense, spherical cluster. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in arid landscapes.
